text.headline: Mapping the Gray Diary
text.text: Explore the landscapes and communities William Fairfax Gray recorded in his diary. This map visualizes his travels through 1830s Texas, linking his firsthand observations to the places where history unfolded.

text.headline: Tuesday, Octo. 6th, 1835
text.text: Left Fredericksburg, Virginia. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Wednesday, Octo. 7, 1835.
text.text: Left Orange, Virginia. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Thursday, Octo. 8, 1835.
text.text: Left Staunton, Virginia. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Friday, Octo. 9, 1835.
text.text: Left Warm Springs, Virginia. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Saturday, Octo. 10, 1835.
text.text: Left Lewisburg, West Virginia Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Sunday, Octo. 11th, 1835.
text.text: Left Charleston, West Virginia. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Monday, Octo. 12, 1835.
text.text: Left Guyandotte, West Virginia on a steamboat down the Ohio. Read more

text.headline: Tuesday, Octo. 13th, 1835.
text.text: Awoke in Portsmouth, Ohio. Read more

text.headline: Wednesday, Octo. 14, 1835.
text.text: Arrived at Cincinnati in the night. Read more

text.headline: Thursday, Octo. 15, 1835.
text.text: Took passage on board the steamboat Algonquin, bound for New Orleans. Read more

text.headline: Friday, Octo. 16, 1835.
text.text: The Algonquin stopped in Louisville, Kentucky. Read more

text.headline: Saturday, Octo. 17, 1835.
text.text: Boarded the Patrick Henry. Read more

text.headline: Sunday, Octo. 18, 1835.
text.text: The Patrick Henry arrived at Owensboro, or Yellow Banks. Read more

text.headline: Monday, Octo. 19, 1835.
text.text: Visited Cave in Rock, near the border between Indiana and Illinois. Read more

text.headline: Tuesday, Octo. 20, 1835.
text.text: The Patrick Henry passed Cumberland Island and Paducah, Kentucky. Read more

text.headline: Wednesday, Octo. 21, 1835.
text.text: The Ohio flows into the Mississippi River, and the Patrick Henry passed the town of Mill's Point, Kentucky. Read more

text.headline: Thursday, Octo. 22nd, 1835.
text.text: The Patrick Henry passed through Randolph and Memphis, both in Tennessee. Read more

text.headline: Friday, Octo. 23rd, 1835.
text.text: The Patrick Henry left Memphis for Helena. Read more

text.headline: Saturday, Octo. 24th, 1835.
text.text: Remained in Helena another day because Gray's company did not board the next steamboat. Read more

text.headline: Sunday, Octo. 25th, 1835.
text.text: Boarded the Superior. Read more

text.headline: Monday, Octo. 26, 1835.
text.text: The Superior stopped at Princeton, Mississippi. Read more

text.headline: Tuesday, Octo. 27, 1835.
text.text: Visited a mill on Lake Jackson and several plantations on Lake Washington in Mississippi. Read more

text.headline: Wednesday, Octo. 28, 1835.
text.text: Visited more plantations and returned to Princeton, Mississippi. Read more

text.headline: Thursday, Octo. 29, 1835.
text.text: Arrived at Vicksburg, Mississippi at 10 o'clock. Read more

text.headline: Friday, Octo. 30, 1835.
text.text: Spent the day looking at land in the area. Read more

text.headline: Saturday, Octo. 31, 1835.
text.text: Introduced to the President of the Commercial and Railroad Bank. Read more

text.headline: Sunday, Nov. 1, 1835.
text.text: Attended a Methodist service in Vicksburg. Read more

text.headline: Monday, Nov. 2, 1835.
text.text: Spent the day copying maps. Read more

text.headline: Tuesday, Nov. 3, 1835.
text.text: Spent the day copying maps. Read more

text.headline: Wednesday, Nov. 4, 1835.
text.text: Spent the day copying maps. Read more

text.headline: Thursday, Nov. 5, 1835.
text.text: Spent the day copying maps. Read more

text.headline: Friday, Nov. 6, 1835.
text.text: Spent the day copying maps. Read more

text.headline: Saturday, Nov. 7, 1835.
text.text: Planned a trip for Clinton, Mississippi. Read more

text.headline: Sunday, Nov. 8, 1835.
text.text: Attended a Presbyterian service in Vicksburg. Read more

text.headline: Monday, Nov. 9, 1835.
text.text: Attended a dance in Vicksburg. Read more

text.headline: Tuesday, Nov. 10, 1835.
text.text: Attended a dinner in Vicksburg. Read more

text.headline: Thursday, Nov. 12, 1835.
text.text: Arrived at Clinton, Mississippi at about 4 o'clock.

text.headline: Jackson, Friday, Nov. 13th, 1835.
text.text: Arrived at Jackson, Mississippi.

text.headline: Clinton, Saturday, Nov. 14, 1835.
text.text: Returned to Clinton.

text.headline: Monday, Nov. 16, 1835.
text.text: Arrived at Vicksburg, Mississippi.

text.headline: Saturday, Nov. 21, 1835.
text.text: Arrived six miles from Manchester, Mississippi.

text.headline: Sunday, Nov. 22, 1835.
text.text: Arrived in Manchester, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Monday, Dec. 7, 1835.
text.text: Arrived in Liverpool, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Tuesday, Dec. 8, 1835.
text.text: Arrived in Vicksburg, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Tuesday, Dec. 22, 1835.
text.text: Arrived in Clinton, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Thursday, Dec. 24, 1835.
text.text: Arrived in Vicksburg, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Saturday, Dec. 26, 1835.
text.text: Arrived in Warrenton, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Sunday, Dec. 27, 1835.
text.text: Arrived in Natchez, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Monday, Dec. 28, 1835.
text.text: Arrived in Donaldsonville, Louisiana. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Tuesday, Dec. 29, 1835.
text.text: Arrived in New Orleans. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Tuesday, Jan. 19, 1836.
text.text: Left New Orleans for Donaldsonville, Louisiana. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Wednesday, Jan. 20, 1836.
text.text: Passed Donaldsonville and St. Francisville, both in Louisiana. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Thursday, Jan. 21, 1836.
text.text: Passed mouth of Atchafalia River and Mississippi River. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Friday, Jan. 22, 1836.
text.text: Passed Alexandria, Louisiana. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Saturday, Jan. 23, 1836.
text.text: Arrived in Natchitoches, Louisiana. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Tuesday, Jan. 26, 1836.
text.text: Arrived in Fort Jesup, Louisiana. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Thursday, Jan. 28, 1836.
text.text: Took Gaines Ferry. The settlement around the ferry later became the town of Pendleton, Texas. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Friday, Jan. 29, 1836.
text.text: Arrived in San Augustine, Texas. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Thursday, June 2, 1836.
text.text: The Superior passed Natchez, Rodney, and Bruinsburg, all in Mississippi. Read more

text.headline: Friday, June 3, 1836.
text.text: The Superior arrived in Vicksburg, Mississippi at 2am. Gray boarded the Heroine at 11pm. Read more

text.headline: Saturday, June 4, 1836.
text.text: Gray is on board the Heroine. Read more

text.headline: Sunday, June 5, 1836.
text.text: The Heroine passed the mouths of the Arkansaw River and the White River. Read more

text.headline: Monday, June 6, 1836.
text.text: Arrived in Memphis. Read more

text.headline: Tuesday, June 7, 1836.
text.text: Passed through Randolph, Tennessee. Read more

text.headline: Wednesday, June 8, 1836.
text.text: Passed Mill's Point and Paducah, both in Kentucky. Read more

text.headline: Thursday, June 9, 1836.
text.text: Passed Livingston County, Kentucky, Pope County, Illinois, and Cave in Rock, also in Illinois. Read more

text.headline: Friday, June 10, 1836.
text.text: Passed Rockport, Illinois, Troy, Indiana, Cloverport and Stevensport, both in Kentucky, and Rome and Leavensworth, both in Indiana. Read more

text.headline: Saturday, June 11, 1836.
text.text: Arrived in Louisville, Kentucky. Read more

text.headline: Sunday, June 12, 1836.
text.text: Attended an Episcopal service in Louisville. Read more

text.headline: Monday, June 13, 1836.
text.text: Remained in Louisville. Read more

text.headline: Tuesday, June 14, 1836.
text.text: Left Louisville in the Ben Franklin. Read more

text.headline: Wednesday, June 15, 1836.
text.text: The Ben Franklin reached Cincinnati. Read more

text.headline: Thursday, June 16, 1836.
text.text: Boarded the Detroit, which passed through Maysville, Kentucky, Alexandria and Manchester, both in Ohio, Vanceburg, Kentucky, and Portsmouth, Ohio. Read more

text.headline: Friday, June 17, 1836.
text.text: Passed Guyandotte, West Virginia, Gallipolis, Ohio, and Point Pleasant, West Virginia. Read more

text.headline: Saturday, June 18, 1836.
text.text: Passed Elizabethtown, Virginia (now Moundsville, West Virginia). Read more

text.headline: Sunday, June 19, 1836.
text.text: Passed Warren, Ohio, Wellsburg, West Virginia, Steubenville, Ohio, Beaver, Pennsylvania, New Philadelphia, Ohio, Freedom, Pennsylvania, and Shaw's Town. Read more

text.headline: Monday, June 20, 1836.
text.text: Arrived in Pittsburgh. Read more

text.headline: Tuesday, June 21, 1836.
text.text: Left Pittsburgh. Read more

text.headline: Wednesday, June 22, 1836.
text.text: Reached Bedford, Pennsylvania by stagecoach. Read more

text.headline: Thursday, June 23, 1836.
text.text: Reached Chambersburg, Pennsylvania by stagecoach. Read more

text.headline: Friday, June 24, 1836.
text.text: Reached Gettysburg, Pennsylvania at 2am and Baltimore at 11pm. Read more

text.headline: Saturday, June 25, 1836.
text.text: Reached Washington DC by noon. Read more

text.headline: Sunday, June 26, 1836.
text.text: Reached Potomac Creek by steamboat, then took a stagecoach for Fredericksburg, Virginia. Read more
